From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From copia +‎ -ar.

Verb

[edit]

copiar (first-person singular indicative present copio, past participle copiáu)

  1. (transitive) to copy (produce something identical)
  2. (transitive) to copy (imitate)

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of copiar
infinitive copiar
gerund copiando
past participle m copiáu, f copiada, n copiao, m pl copiaos, f pl copiaes
person first singular
yo 		second singular
tu 		third singular
él/elli 		first plural
nosotros/nós 		second plural
vosotros/vós 		third plural
ellos
indicative present copio copies copia copiamos copiáis copien
imperfect copiaba copiabes copiaba copiábemos, copiábamos copiabeis, copiabais copiaben
preterite copié copiasti, copiesti copió copiemos copiastis, copiestis copiaron
pluperfect copiare, copiara copiares, copiaras copiare, copiara copiáremos, copiáramos copiareis, copiarais copiaren, copiaran
future copiaré copiarás copiará copiaremos copiaréis copiarán
conditional copiaría copiaríes copiaría copiaríemos, copiaríamos copiaríeis, copiaríais copiaríen
subjunctive present copie copies, copias copie copiemos copiéis copien, copian
imperfect copiare, copiara copiares, copiaras copiare, copiara copiáremos, copiáramos copiareis, copiarais copiaren, copiaran
imperative — copia — — copiái —

Derived terms

[edit]
  • copiador
  • copiadora

Further reading

[edit]
  • “copiar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN
  • Xosé Lluis García Arias (2002–2004), “copiar (verb 1)”, in Diccionario general de la lengua asturiana [General Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Spanish), Editorial Prensa Asturiana, →ISBN

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From còpia +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [ku.piˈa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [ko.piˈa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [ko.piˈaɾ]
  • Homophone: copià
  • Audio (Catalonia):(file)

Verb

[edit]

copiar (first-person singular present copio, first-person singular preterite copií, past participle copiat)

  1. (transitive) to copy
  2. (transitive) to take down (dictation)
  3. (transitive, figurative) to imitate
    Synonym: imitar
  4. (transitive, computing) to copy (place a copy in memory)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of copiar (first conjugation)

gerund copiant
past participle masculine feminine
singular copiat copiada
plural copiats copiades
person singular plural
first second third first second third

preterite copií copiares copià copiàrem copiàreu copiaren
conditional copiaria copiaries copiaria copiaríem copiaríeu copiarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres

vós 		ells/elles

vós 		vostès
affirmative — copia copiï copiem copieu copiïn
negative (no) — no copiïs no copiï no copiem no copieu no copiïn

Derived terms

[edit]
  • copiadora

See also

[edit]
  • enganxar
  • retallar

Further reading

[edit]
  • “copiar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.
  • “copiar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “copiar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “copiar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

Portuguese

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /ko.piˈa(ʁ)/ [ko.pɪˈa(h)], (faster pronunciation) /koˈpja(ʁ)/ [koˈpja(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /ko.piˈa(ʁ)/ [ko.pɪˈa(h)], (faster pronunciation) /koˈpja(ʁ)/ [koˈpja(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /ko.piˈa(ɾ)/ [ko.pɪˈa(ɾ)], (faster pronunciation) /koˈpja(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /ko.piˈa(ʁ)/ [ko.pɪˈa(χ)], (faster pronunciation) /koˈpja(ʁ)/ [koˈpja(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /ko.piˈa(ɻ)/ [ko.pɪˈa(ɻ)], (faster pronunciation) /koˈpja(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kuˈpjaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kuˈpjaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /kuˈpja.ɾi/

Etymology 1

[edit]

From cópia +‎ -ar.

Verb

[edit]

copiar (first-person singular present copio, first-person singular preterite copiei, past participle copiado)

  1. (transitive) to copy; to produce something identical
Conjugation
[edit]
    Conjugation of copiar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Derived terms
[edit]
  • copiador
  • copiadora
  • copiar e colar

Etymology 2

[edit]

From Old Tupi kopiara.

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • copiara

Noun

[edit]

copiar m (plural copiares)

  1. (Northeast Brazil) a type of porch

Further reading

[edit]
  • “copiar”, in Dicionário Aulete Digital (in Portuguese), Rio de Janeiro: Lexikon Editora Digital, 2008–2025
  • “copiar”, in Dicionário inFormal (in Portuguese), 2006–2025
  • “copiar” in Dicionário Aberto based on Novo Diccionário da Língua Portuguesa de Cândido de Figueiredo, 1913
  • “copiar”, in Dicionário infopédia da Lingua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Porto: Porto Editora, 2003–2025
  • “copiar”, in Michaelis Dicionário Brasileiro da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), São Paulo: Editora Melhoramentos, 2015–2025
  • “copiar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Anagrams

[edit]
  • pícaro, -cárpio, aprico, piroca

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From copia +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /koˈpjaɾ/ [koˈpjaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: co‧piar

Verb

[edit]

copiar (first-person singular present copio, first-person singular preterite copié, past participle copiado)

  1. (transitive) to copy, to crib
  2. (transitive) to imitate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of copiar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive copiar
gerund copiando
past participle masculine feminine
singular copiado copiada
plural copiados copiadas
singular plural

vos 		él/ella/ello

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • copiador
  • copiadora

Further reading

[edit]
  • “copiar”, in Diccionario de la lengua española [Dictionary of the Spanish Language] (in Spanish), online version 23.8, Royal Spanish Academy [Spanish: Real Academia Española], 10 December 2024

Venetan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

(This etymology is missing or incomplete. Please add to it, or discuss it at the Etymology scriptorium.) Compare Italian copiare.

Verb

[edit]

copiar

  1. (transitive) to copy
  2. (transitive) to imitate

Conjugation

[edit]

* Venetan conjugation varies from one region to another. Hence, the following conjugation should be considered as typical, not as exhaustive.

Conjugation of copiar (first conjugation)
infinitive copiar
auxiliary verb aver gerund copiando
past participle copià
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative mi ti eło / eła noialtri / noialtre voialtri / voialtre łuri / łore
present copio (te) copii (el/ła) copia copiémo, copiòn copié (i/łe) copia
imperfect copiava (te) copiavi (el/ła) copiava copiàvimo copiavi (i/łe) copiava
future copiarò (te) copiarè (el/ła) copiarà copiarémo copiarè (i/łe) copiarà
conditional copiarìa (te) copiarisi (el/ła) copiarìa copiarìsimo copiarisi (i/łe) copiarìa
subjunctive che mi che ti che eło / eła che noialtri / noialtre che voialtri / voialtre che łuri / łore
present copie, copia (te) copii (el/ła) copie, (el/ła) copia copiémo, copione copié (i/łe) copie, (i/łe) copia
imperfect copiase (te) copiasi (el/ła) copiase copiàsimo copiasi (i/łe) copiase
imperative — ti eło / eła noialtri / noialtre voialtri / voialtre łuri / łore
— (te) copia (el/ła) copia, (el/ła) copie copiémo copié (i/łe) copia, (i/łe) copie
